other_tests.findings: The liver is normal size with prominence of the periportal space, most consistent with cirrhosis. The echotexture is slightly heterogeneous. There are no focal hepatic lesions. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilation. The gallbladder is slightly distended and filled with sludge. The gallbladder wall is thickened and edematous, which is unchanged from the prior exam. A moderate amount of pericholecystic fluid appears similar or just slightly increased in amount.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Gallbladder wall is thickened and edematous, unchanged from the prior exam.
